intro: Ligusticum tenuilobum, commonly known as narrow-lobed lovage, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, feathery foliage. Its small white or greenish flowers bloom in late summer, and it is sometimes used in traditional Chinese medicine. The plant's botanical features make it distinct within its genus, with its narrow leaf lobes and specific habitat preferences.
